content.raw:
Hi Nathan, 

I am currently facing the same issue as mentioned by carlos on 2015-01-10, i've downloaded the tar.gz file from the link you posted above, and have followed the installation instructions as posted on the player website, with the only exception being the usage of your mentioned cmake command. 

Using the pkg-config --modversion playercore command, i've checked that player 3.0.2 has been installed on my ubuntu trusty. 

It's my first time doing this, so i'm really unsure as what i should do with regards to the set PKG_CONFIG_PATH step mentioned by carlos, so i'd really appreciate it if you could guide me through this process!

Thank you!
content.html:
Hi Nathan,

I am currently facing the same issue as mentioned by carlos on 2015-01-10, i've downloaded the tar.gz file from the link you posted above, and have followed the installation instructions as posted on the player website, with the only exception being the usage of your mentioned cmake command.

Using the pkg-config --modversion playercore command, i've checked that player 3.0.2 has been installed on my ubuntu trusty.

It's my first time doing this, so i'm really unsure as what i should do with regards to the set PKG_CONFIG_PATH step mentioned by carlos, so i'd really appreciate it if you could guide me through this process!

Thank you!

update.description:
This PR accomplishes:

1. Position, camera, and laser interface compatibility with Player.

1. Removes old player .cfg files to eliminate confusion.

1. Adds three new worlds:

    1. Pioneer2dx + camera

    1. Pioneer2dx  + laser

    1. Pioneer2dx  + laser + camera

Here are the [tutorials](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-request/121).

To test, you'll need to install Player from source. [Here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/0b6lzjk9e0ewulb/player.tar.gz?dl=0) a version of player that compiles on trusty using the following cmake command:


```
#!cmake

cmake -DBUILD_EXAMPLES=OFF -DPLAYER_BUILD_TESTS=OFF -DENABLE_DRIVER_READLOG=OFF -DBUILD_CC_TESTS=OFF ..
```
update.title: Update to player interfaces

content.raw:
I'm probably doing something wrong but I'm trying to run player for testing the tutorials and this PR and I got this error when running `player position2.cfg` following the tutorial:

```
#!c++
caguero@talos:~/gazebo_position2d$ player position2d.cfg 
Registering driver
Player v.3.0.2

* Part of the Player/Stage/Gazebo Project [http://playerstage.sourceforge.net].
* Copyright (C) 2000 - 2009 Brian Gerkey, Richard Vaughan, Andrew Howard,
* Nate Koenig, and contributors. Released under the GNU General Public License.
* Player comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.  This is free software, and you
* are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; see COPYING
* for details.

error   : Sorry, no support for shared libraries, so can't load plugins.
error   : You should install libltdl, which is part of GNU libtool, then re-compile player.
error   : failed to load plugin: libgazebo_player
error   : failed to parse config file position2d.cfg driver blocks
```

I'm in Ubuntu Trusty and I have installed `libltdl7` and `libltdl-dev`. I tried installing player in `/usr/local` and in `/usr` but got the same error. Any ideas?

content.raw:
So far everything looks good.  The tutorial update is good, but now there's conflicting information and .world files in the examples/player/*.  Either:

1. The tutorials should be updated to reference the Player config files under examples/player, the world files under examples/player/* should be deleted, and the readmes under examples/player/* should be updated, or
2. The tutorials under examples/player should be deleted entirely in lieu of the online tutorials. 

I think 1 is preferable for consistency and offline availability.  I can take a stab at it over the coming weeks if you don't get a chance.
content.html:
So far everything looks good. The tutorial update is good, but now there's conflicting information and .world files in the examples/player/*. Either:

  1. The tutorials should be updated to reference the Player config files under examples/player, the world files under examples/player/ should be deleted, and the readmes under examples/player/ should be updated, or
  2. The tutorials under examples/player should be deleted entirely in lieu of the online tutorials.

I think 1 is preferable for consistency and offline availability. I can take a stab at it over the coming weeks if you don't get a chance.

Could you backport the fix from pull request #1326 pull request #1276? It added the GAZEBO_VISIBLE to GazeboDriver.hh instead of GazeboDriver.cc. It will eliminate a conflict when merging forward.

7298099ad596

diff -r 7298099ad596 -r 14e57b5cca5f interfaces/player/GazeboDriver.hh
--- a/interfaces/player/GazeboDriver.hh Wed Nov 05 23:21:57 2014 -0800

@@ -28,6 +28,11 @@
 #include "player.h"
 #include "gazebo/util/system.hh"

+extern "C"
+{
+  GAZEBO_VISIBLE int player_driver_init(DriverTable *_table);
+}
+

 /// \brief Gazebo player driver
 /// \{

content.raw:
The position2d interface needs a small fix: the pose.pa in the published data message should be filled with the robot's yaw angle, not its z position.  

Also, Now that you're using stamped messages in the position2d and laser interfaces, you can fill in Player's published data timestamp with the gazebo timestamp instead using the wall clock time.

See the diff in pull request #1326 for my attempt at the above fixes.

player_driver_init visibility was fixed in pull request #1276, maybe that should be merged into 4.1 instead of adding it to this patch.
content.html:
The position2d interface needs a small fix: the pose.pa in the published data message should be filled with the robot's yaw angle, not its z position.

Also, Now that you're using stamped messages in the position2d and laser interfaces, you can fill in Player's published data timestamp with the gazebo timestamp instead using the wall clock time.

See the diff in pull request #1326 for my attempt at the above fixes.

player_driver_init visibility was fixed in pull request #1276, maybe that should be merged into 4.1 instead of adding it to this patch.
